comments:
I don't really have much useful information to provide for this defect other 
than it keeps happening.  I've attached my log in case something earlier 
during execution has something to do with it.  Basically, after editing some 
number of files and hitting the save button, which triggers a compile, Eclipse 
crashes.  The number of changes made and the number of editors open is 
different each time.  I'm using the 1.0.3 version of VSS, which wasn't written 
for Eclipse 3.0, but I don't think this should come into play during 
compilation, which is when the platform crashes.  I guess it's also important 
to mention that I'm compiling my application against Sun's JDK 1.3.1_07, and 
the application is run within a Eclipse 2.1.1 platform (Thus, the Eclipse plug-
ins within the workspace are from the 2.1.1 version).

All the log entries below involve third-party plugins. Please contact your
plugin provider to solve those issues. 
Eclipse 3.0 is expected to run existing 2.1 plugins without changes. Feedback
from plugin writers on specific compatibility issues is wanted. But we need
simple test cases that allow us the reproduce reported problems without
requiring any third-party plugins.

The first issue (UnsatisfiedLinkError loading library), if reproducible with a
simple test case, should be reported against Equinox/General. The second one
(IllegalArgumentException from WorkbenchPage#openEditor), against Platform/UI.
